alert.note: Alert for Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 18 at 7:45PM CST until January 20 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL TENSAS PARISH...SOUTHWESTERN WARREN AND CENTRAL CLAIBORNE COUNTIES... At 745 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Newellton, or 25 miles southwest of Vicksburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Port Gibson, Reganton, Yokena and Rocky Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern and west central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
